alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Butler; Carter; Ripley; Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 26 at 5:54PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Fog possible in the Ozark Foothills this evening... For those traveling west or east through the Ozark Foothills this evening, you may experience patchy areas of dense fog with visibilities dropping below a quarter of a mile this evening. The change in visibility on the roadway may change rapidly over a short distance. The most impacted areas due to the fog will be over parts of Carter, Ripley, Wayne, western Butler and Bollinger counties in southeast Missouri. This fog will be developing ahead of a northward moving warm front. This front should move north of the impacted region after 10 pm CST. After that time, the visibilities on the road should improve markedly. In the meantime, if you are traveling in this area, be sure to use low beam and fog lights, if available. Leave plenty of room between yourself and other vehicles and use your signals ahead of time if you plan to change lanes. Do not drive faster than the conditions allow.
